thread.title_full: As 'Chicago Fire' restarts, Lt. Casey goes undercover - Entertainment & Life - providencejournal.com - Providence, RI

author:
Chuck Barney
Contra Costa Times
title: As 'Chicago Fire' restarts, Lt. Casey goes undercover - Entertainment & Life
text: Tuesday In the Season 4 premiere of "Chicago Fire," Lt. Casey (Jesse Spencer) finds himself in dangerous territory while in the middle of an undercover operation. Chicago citizens take charge in a protest of a drug den. 10 p.m., NBC Wednesday “American Horror Story: Hotel” continues its ghastly run. Tonight, fashion designer Will Drake (Cheyenne Jackson) tries to bring a touch of couture to the creepy Hotel Cortez, and a model catches the eye of the Countess (Lady Gaga). 10 p.m., FX. Thursday Let’s just call it “The Blacklist” road show. This week, Red (James Spader) and Liz (Megan Boone) head for the Midwest in their ongoing quest to take down the Cabal and exonerate Liz. 9 p.m., NBC. Friday “Truth Be Told” is a new sitcom that follows two couples (Mark-Paul Gosselaar and Vanessa Lachey; Tone Bell and Bresha Webb) and their frank discussions about race, sex, politics and other touchy subjects. But the truth is we just want it to be funny. 8:30 p.m., NBC. Saturday “Amy Schumer: Live at the Apollo” is a new stand-up special that has the country’s hottest comedian bringing her honest and unapologetic humor to an audience at the iconic New York theater. The hour-long program was directed by Chris Rock. 10 p.m., HBO. Sunday "Blood & Oil" has Billy (Chace Crawford) seeking revenge after being conned by Hap (Don Johnson). Wick (Scott Michael Foster) continues to see Jules (India De Beaufort) and ignores Hap's wishes. 9 p.m., ABC. Monday The "13 Nights of Halloween" kicks off with an airing of the final Harry Potter films, "Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1" and "Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2," followed by "Hocus Pocus" and "Tim Burton's Corpse Bride." 1:30 p.m., ABC Family.
